page.title: 04Policing The Shelsleys
page.content: In this rural area with a low population there is little or no indictable crime. The Shelsleys do not have a resident policeman but the area is covered from the subpolice station at Great Witley, five miles away and police cars from this or the main station at Stourport, nine miles distant, regularly patrol the valley. The three police officers who live in the vicinity have a good knowledge of the inhabitants of the area. For local problems the police station at Great Witley can be telephoned and when it is not being manned, telephone calls are dealt with directly at Stourport or by the 999 system. Four{Justices of the Peace}live in the area and the nearest magistrates' court is held at The Hundred House, Great Witley.
